short_summary: Canada is seeking proposals from qualified Offerors to provide supply of a shipboard-style fire simulator which will be used to deliver Marine Emergency Duty training at the Canadian Coast Guard College in Sydney, Nova Scotia.
description: This procurement is to provide a fire simulator for the Canadian Coast Guard.  The Canadian Coast Guard College is seeking a fire simulator that can be used to deliver training in emergency response, specifically in a shipboard environment. The selected fire simulator must be able to mimic the conditions found on a ship during an emergency situation. The simulator should be easy to use and maintain, and it should be able to retrieve information and send alerts to emergency responders. Additionally, the simulator should be able to keep track of the location of the emergency and the personnel involved.  The fire simulator must be able to meet the following technical specifications:  - The simulator must be a modular unit that can be easily transported and installed. - The simulator must be designed to operate in a shipboard environment. - The simulator must be able to mimic the conditions found on a ship during an emergency situation. - The simulator should be easy to use and maintain. - The simulator should be able to retrieve information and send alerts to emergency responders. - The simulator should be able to keep track of the location of the emergency and the personnel involved.

# Government Tender Announcement
## Description

Canada invites interested suppliers to submit proposals for the supply of a shipboard-style fire simulator. The fire simulator will be used to deliver Marine Emergency Duty training to the Canadian Coast Guard College in Sydney, Nova Scotia.

### Key Information

* **Tender Reference Number**: WS4244958528
* **Amendment Number**: 5
* **Publication Date**: October 5, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date**: November 15, 2023 at 2:00 PM EST (local time)
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: November 16, 2023
* **Procurement Category**: Government of Canada
* **Notice Type**: Request for Proposal
* **Procurement Method**: Competitive - Open bidding
* **Selection Criteria**: Lowest Price
* **Trade Agreements**: CPTPP, Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canadian Free Trade Agreement, among others.

### Contracting Entity Information

* **Contracting Entity**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **Address**: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0S5, Canada

### Contact Information

* **Point of Contact**: Richard Parsons, Contract Administrator
* **Email**: [richard.parsons@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:richard.parsons@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
* **Phone**: (Not provided)
* **Fax**: (Not provided)

### Regions

* **Regions of Opportunity**: None specified
* **Regions of Delivery**: Nova Scotia

### Documentation and Attachments

The tender documentation and attachments can be found at: [https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17637692?extsite=MTc2Mzc2OTJfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17637692?extsite=MTc2Mzc2OTJfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==)

Note:
Nationals from countries not covered by the subject Trade Agreements may be included. However, a Trade Agreement will be required.

Canada employs an open and transparent bidding process. All inquiries must be received by the contracting officer. Failure to respond to inquiries may result in rejection of the proposal. Please note that confidentiality agreements or statements of confidentiality may be required.
